arch:property.oc:show_val: In the south central part of Trench 88 or at 891.998 m.
Closing Elevation: Unknown, but we assume it to be the same as the opening elevation plus the height of the pavement blocks.
The Locus 10 upper stairway, the Locus 11 lower stairway, the Locus 5 west corridor to the baths, and the loci of surrounding walls.
Landing Platform between the Upper Stairs and Lower Stairs
With all the construction wall loci of this Trench 88. Loci 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 10, 11, 12, and 13.
This landing platform between the upper and lower steps measures 3.50 m north south-by- 3.66 m east west.

In general this structure is set with limestone header pavers. One large paver measures 1.60 m-by-0.62 m in width-by-0.07 m depth. In the southwest is a triangular-shaped hole carved into the pavement for water drainage. It is uneven, measuring 0.11-by-0.122 m in width.
Opening elevation: 0.68 m below the Sub Datum 1 of Trench 88.
